intro: Erucastrum elongatum, commonly known as the longleaf erucaceae, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Erucastrum elongatum is typically found in moist, disturbed soils in temperate regions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and botanical classification.
